test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a desktop web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge) at standard resolution (e.g., 1920x1080).
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator UI loads correctly and is visually aligned.

Steps.Step Description: Resize the browser window to various widths (e.g., 1200px, 1024px, 800px, 600px).
Steps.Expected Result: UI elements rearrange or resize appropriately without overlapping or breaking layout.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all main features (e.g., buttons, forms, navigation) at each resolution.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional at each tested resolution.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator deployed and accessible in UAT environment. Tester has access to a desktop computer with a modern web browser.
test_cases.Functionality: Responsiveness on Desktop
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default landing state.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is fully usable and visually correct at all tested desktop resolutions.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Mobile Devices (iOS/Android)

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a mobile browser (Safari for iOS, Chrome for Android) on a smartphone.
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator UI loads correctly and adapts to mobile screen size.

Steps.Step Description: Rotate the device between portrait and landscape modes.
Steps.Expected Result: UI elements rearrange or resize appropriately for both orientations.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all main features (e.g., buttons, forms, navigation) in both orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional in both portrait and landscape modes.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator deployed and accessible in UAT environment. Tester has access to iOS and Android smartphones with modern browsers.
test_cases.Functionality: Responsiveness on Mobile
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default landing state.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is fully usable and visually correct in both portrait and landscape modes on mobile devices.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Tablet Devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a tablet browser (Safari for iPad, Chrome for Android tablets).
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator UI loads correctly and adapts to tablet screen size.

Steps.Step Description: Rotate the device between portrait and landscape modes.
Steps.Expected Result: UI elements rearrange or resize appropriately for both orientations.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all main features (e.g., buttons, forms, navigation) in both orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional in both portrait and landscape modes.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator deployed and accessible in UAT environment. Tester has access to iOS and Android tablets with modern browsers.
test_cases.Functionality: Responsiveness on Tablet
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default landing state.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is fully usable and visually correct in both portrait and landscape modes on tablet devices.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Accessibility and Usability on Low-Resolution Devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a browser or emulator set to a low resolution (e.g., 320x480, 480x800).
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator UI loads and adapts to the small screen size.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access all main features and navigation elements.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and no critical UI elements are hidden or inaccessible.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator deployed and accessible in UAT environment. Tester has access to a device or emulator capable of low-resolution display.
test_cases.Functionality: Responsiveness on Low-Resolution Devices
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default landing state.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is usable and visually correct on low-resolution devices without loss of functionality.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Layout Consistency Across Supported Browsers

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Safari browsers at standard desktop resolution.
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator UI loads correctly in each browser.

Steps.Step Description: Resize the browser window to various widths (e.g., 1200px, 1024px, 800px, 600px) in each browser.
Steps.Expected Result: UI elements rearrange or resize appropriately in each browser without layout issues.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator deployed and accessible in UAT environment. Tester has access to all supported browsers.
test_cases.Functionality: Cross-Browser Responsiveness
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default landing state.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is visually consistent and responsive across all supported browsers.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Responsiveness with Dynamic Content

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application and perform actions that generate dynamic content (e.g., add/remove items, expand/collapse sections).
Steps.Expected Result: Dynamic content is displayed correctly and does not break the layout.

Steps.Step Description: Resize the browser window or rotate the device after dynamic content is loaded.
Steps.Expected Result: UI remains responsive and dynamic content adapts to the new screen size or orientation.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator deployed and accessible in UAT environment. Tester has access to a device with a modern browser.
test_cases.Functionality: Responsiveness with Dynamic Content
test_cases.Dataset: Use actions that trigger dynamic content (e.g., add items, expand sections).
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator remains responsive and visually correct when dynamic content is present and the viewport changes.

test_cases.Title: Carosello Home Page - Visualizzazione corretta del carosello in condizioni standard

Steps.Step Description: Accedere alla Home Page dell'applicazione tramite browser o app mobile.
Steps.Expected Result: La Home Page viene caricata correttamente.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare la presenza del carosello nella posizione prevista sulla Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: Il carosello è visibile nella posizione prevista.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che il carosello mostri almeno una card/precompilata.
Steps.Expected Result: Almeno una card/precompilata è visibile all'interno del carosello.

test_cases.Preconditions: L'utente deve avere accesso alla Home Page. Il carosello deve essere configurato e popolato con almeno una card/precompilata.
test_cases.Functionality: Visualizzazione carosello Home Page
test_cases.Dataset: Utente generico, Home Page popolata con dati di esempio.
test_cases.Expected Result: Il carosello viene visualizzato correttamente sulla Home Page con almeno una card/precompilata.

test_cases.Title: Carosello Home Page - Visualizzazione Skeleton durante caricamento dati

Steps.Step Description: Accedere alla Home Page dell'applicazione con una connessione lenta o simulare un ritardo nel caricamento dei dati del carosello.
Steps.Expected Result: La Home Page viene caricata e il carosello inizia a caricarsi.

Steps.Step Description: Osservare la sezione del carosello durante il caricamento dei dati.
Steps.Expected Result: Viene visualizzato uno skeleton (placeholder grafico) al posto delle card/precompilate fino al completamento del caricamento.

Steps.Step Description: Attendere il completamento del caricamento dei dati del carosello.
Steps.Expected Result: Lo skeleton viene sostituito dalle card/precompilate effettive una volta che i dati sono disponibili.

test_cases.Preconditions: L'utente deve avere accesso alla Home Page. Il carosello deve essere configurato per mostrare lo skeleton durante il caricamento dati.
test_cases.Functionality: Skeleton caricamento carosello Home Page
test_cases.Dataset: Utente generico, simulazione di caricamento lento.
test_cases.Expected Result: Durante il caricamento dei dati del carosello viene visualizzato uno skeleton, che scompare mostrando le card/precompilate una volta completato il caricamento.

test_cases.Title: Carosello Home Page - Struttura e contenuto della singola card/precompilata

Steps.Step Description: Accedere alla Home Page dell'applicazione.
Steps.Expected Result: La Home Page viene caricata correttamente.

Steps.Step Description: Individuare una card/precompilata all'interno del carosello.
Steps.Expected Result: Una card/precompilata è visibile.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che la card/precompilata mostri tutte le informazioni richieste (es. titolo, descrizione, immagine, pulsanti azione).
Steps.Expected Result: La card/precompilata mostra tutte le informazioni richieste secondo le specifiche di design.

test_cases.Preconditions: L'utente deve avere accesso alla Home Page. Il carosello deve essere popolato con card/precompilate complete.
test_cases.Functionality: Struttura card/precompilata carosello Home Page
test_cases.Dataset: Utente generico, card/precompilate con dati completi.
test_cases.Expected Result: Ogni card/precompilata del carosello mostra tutte le informazioni richieste secondo le specifiche di design.

test_cases.Title: Carosello Home Page - Gestione cache delle card/precompilate

Steps.Step Description: Accedere alla Home Page dell'applicazione e attendere il caricamento del carosello.
Steps.Expected Result: Il carosello viene caricato e le card/precompilate sono visibili.

Steps.Step Description: Ricaricare la Home Page senza svuotare la cache del browser/app.
Steps.Expected Result: Il carosello viene caricato utilizzando i dati in cache, riducendo i tempi di caricamento.

Steps.Step Description: Svuotare la cache del browser/app e ricaricare la Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: Il carosello viene caricato nuovamente dai dati di origine, non dalla cache.

test_cases.Preconditions: L'utente deve avere accesso alla Home Page. Il sistema deve implementare la cache per le card/precompilate.
test_cases.Functionality: Cache card/precompilate carosello Home Page
test_cases.Dataset: Utente generico, browser/app con cache abilitata.
test_cases.Expected Result: Il carosello utilizza la cache per caricare le card/precompilate quando disponibile e ricarica dai dati di origine quando la cache viene svuotata.

test_cases.Expected Result: Il carosello viene visualizzato correttamente nel tab Bet Builder con almeno una card/precompilata relativa all'avvenimento selezionato.

test_cases.Title: Display of Randomly Generated Same Game Parlay Bets on Full Responsive Frontend (Italy)

Steps.Step Description: Access the Betting Full Responsive frontend (Italy version) via desktop browser.
Steps.Expected Result: The homepage loads successfully with all standard betting features visible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to a sports event eligible for Same Game Parlay (SGP) bets.
Steps.Expected Result: The event page displays available betting options.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the section for precompiled SGP bets generated by the SGP Generator.
Steps.Expected Result: A section is visible showing multiple precompiled SGP bets.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each SGP bet displayed is unique and appears to be randomly generated.
Steps.Expected Result: Each SGP bet is distinct and not repeated, confirming random generation.

test_cases.Preconditions: SGP Generator is active and generating precompiled SGP bets. User is not logged in (anonymous access).
test_cases.Functionality: Display of SGP precompiled bets
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses live SGP Generator output)
test_cases.Expected Result: The Betting Full Responsive frontend (Italy) displays a set of unique, randomly generated SGP precompiled bets for eligible events.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carosello Display and Title on Home Page (Full Responsive Online)

test_cases.Title: Carosello HP non visualizzato se nessuna precompilata ricevuta dal backend

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards are cached and persist for X minutes on homepage revisit

Steps.Step Description: Open the website and land on the homepage (HP) at time T0.

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards are refreshed after cache expiration (after X minutes)

Steps.Step Description: Note the content and order of the precompiled cards displayed.

test_cases.Title: Verify cache duration X is only changeable via release and not runtime

Steps.Step Description: Check the current configuration value of cache duration X in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: Current value of X is identified.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change the value of X via runtime configuration (e.g., admin panel, API, or hot-reload mechanism if available).
Steps.Expected Result: System does not allow changing X at runtime; change is rejected or not applied.

Steps.Step Description: Deploy a new release with a different value for X.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the new value of X after release deployment.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the new value of X is now active by repeating cache duration tests (as in TC-001 and TC-002).
Steps.Expected Result: Cache duration reflects the new value of X only after release.

test_cases.Preconditions: Access to system configuration and deployment tools. Knowledge of current and new values for X. Sufficient permissions to attempt configuration changes and deploy releases.
test_cases.Functionality: Configuration management of cache duration
test_cases.Dataset: Current and new values for X as per test plan.
test_cases.Expected Result: Cache duration X can only be changed via a new release, not at runtime.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only configuration management, not cache behavior.

Steps.Expected Result: User A sees the same precompiled cards as at T0.

Steps.Step Description: User B navigates away and returns to homepage within X minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: User B sees the same precompiled cards as at T0 for their session.

Steps.Expected Result: A list of events with both expired and non-expired start times is available.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page (HP) and observe the carousel cards.
Steps.Expected Result: Only events whose start date-time has not yet passed are displayed in the carousel cards.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one event in the backend response has a start date-time in the past and at least one has a start date-time in the future.
test_cases.Functionality: Event Filtering in Carousel
test_cases.Dataset: Events with mixed start date-times (past and future).
test_cases.Expected Result: The carousel displays only cards for events whose start date-time has not yet passed.

test_cases.Title: Expired Events Are Not Displayed After Cache Retention

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page (HP) and note the events displayed in the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: Events with future start date-times are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from HP and wait until the start date-time of one or more displayed events passes (but before cache expiry).
Steps.Expected Result: Some events become expired while the cache is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to HP before the cache expiry time (X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Only non-expired events are displayed; expired events are no longer shown in the carousel.

test_cases.Preconditions: Cache is active and contains at least one event that will expire during navigation.
test_cases.Functionality: Event Filtering with Active Cache
test_cases.Dataset: Events with start date-times set to expire during test execution; cache expiry set to X minutes.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon returning to HP before cache expiry, only non-expired events are shown in the carousel.

test_cases.Title: Frontend Requests New Events When All Cached Events Expire

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to HP and ensure all events in the carousel have start date-times that will expire soon.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel displays events that will all expire before cache expiry.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from HP and wait until all events' start date-times have passed (but before cache expiry).
Steps.Expected Result: All cached events are now expired.

Steps.Step Description: Return to HP before cache expiry.
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend makes a new call to the backend to fetch new events.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the carousel after the backend call.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel displays new, non-expired events. Cache timer is reset.

test_cases.Preconditions: All cached events will expire before cache expiry; backend is able to provide new events.
test_cases.Functionality: Cache Expiry and Backend Refresh
test_cases.Dataset: Events with start date-times set to expire before cache expiry; backend prepared to return new events.
test_cases.Expected Result: If all cached events are expired, frontend fetches new events from backend and resets cache timer.

test_cases.Title: No Events Displayed When Backend Returns Only Expired Events

Steps.Step Description: Configure backend to return only events with start date-times in the past.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend response contains only expired events.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to HP and observe the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: No event cards are displayed in the carousel.

test_cases.Preconditions: Backend returns only expired events.
test_cases.Functionality: Handling of All Expired Events
test_cases.Dataset: Events with only past start date-times.
test_cases.Expected Result: Carousel is empty when backend returns only expired events.

test_cases.Title: Cache Timer Resets After Backend Refresh

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to HP and ensure all events in the carousel will expire before cache expiry.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel displays events that will all expire soon.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from HP and wait until all events expire (before cache expiry).
Steps.Expected Result: All cached events are expired.

Steps.Step Description: Return to HP and trigger backend refresh (as all events are expired).
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend fetches new events and resets the cache timer.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away and return to HP within the new cache period.
Steps.Expected Result: No backend call is made; carousel displays the newly cached events.

test_cases.Preconditions: All cached events will expire before cache expiry; backend is able to provide new events.
test_cases.Functionality: Cache Timer Reset Logic
test_cases.Dataset: Events with start date-times set to expire before cache expiry; backend prepared to return new events.
test_cases.Expected Result: After backend refresh, cache timer is reset and subsequent HP visits within cache period do not trigger backend calls.

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Tracking Rejects Invalid SGP Card Plays

Steps.Expected Result: The system rejects the play and does not process it.

Steps.Step Description: Check the DWH tracking logs for any record of the rejected play.
Steps.Expected Result: No DWH tracking record is created for the invalid play attempt.
